Baglioni Hotel Luna – The Leading Hotels of the World
8.5 Excellent
Based on 48 reviews

This is the best hotel I ever had ! If you like to stay in a beautiful luxury hotel I'm highly recommend this hotel.

The interior deco and room was very unique and feels like you are in the royal place. Breakfast, environment, services are perfect ! Just right next to the centre attraction Piazza San Marco (1 minute walk). Luna Baglioni is exactly behind the Chanel boutique, fashion street. Easy access to everywhere because there got a speed boat/gondola station was only in front of the luna's entrance.

Show more
atira , Malaysia
Hotel Gardena Venice
7.8 Very good
Based on 207 reviews

We arrived in Venice via bus (from airport) and left via train so the hotel was ideally situated as there were only two bridges to cross (60kgs luggage).

The hotel fronts onto a quiet canal and was only 30 metres from the Grand Canal, perfect. A number of good inexpensive restaurants were a stone's throw away as were a number of good gift shops, with reasonable prices. The room was very nice, clean, and decorated in an old style but lacked power sockets to allow use of a laptop, camera and phone re-chargers. The bathroom was OK. Generally we found the hotel to be efficient rather than friendly, but as we were there only two nights it didn't impact on our enjoyment. Not a bad hotel for the price.

Show more
Richard , Australia
Venice Times Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 68 reviews

Staff are very nice. We're glad we booked this place. If you have a LOT of luggage and you plan to book diff hotel in the grand canal area and plan to take the public transpo - this is a BIG hassle because we've seen a lot of tourists did this and it's really tight in the boat.

Unless you're going to take the Taxi Boat which are ridiculously expensive. That's the reason why we loved this place because it's close to the train station and going to the grand canal is easy(you can buy unlimited trip for 2 days or 5 days - depending on your stay). We didn't have to drag our 4 bug luggages to the boat and across the grand canal where there are a LOT of people. Breakfast has a great spread. To top it all off, the receptionists are very welcoming and will give you tips on how to navigate across the area. Will definitely be back if we had a chance.

Show more
Jorge , China
Cavalletto & Doge Orseolo
7.4 Very good
Based on 128 reviews

The room was quite dark, with very old mattresses. We were put in an annex across the alley from the main building.

This was accessed by what felt like the service entrance to a much nicer hotel which, unfortunately, we never got to see. The breakfast was over-priced (you can do much better 20 meters up the canal) and the free wifi was only accessible from a 3 square meter area in the lobby at speeds that sent most guests away in frustration. The staff seemed largely indifferent to their guests.

Show more
Jonathan , United States
Hotel Plaza
8.2 Excellent
Based on 656 reviews

The lobby was the same as the website but not the room. The room need upgrading, sort of old everything in the room.

The room should carry the same theme & feel as the lobby but it wasn't. Two different world the room and the lobby! You can be fooled by all the fancy pix. The shower gel and soap was enough for 1 person only. So bring ur own soap or be ready to ask for more! The location was far from Venice but it was easy to reach to Venice by train or the bus. You have to buy the bus ticket from a coffee shop next to the hotel €1.50 per ticket. Taking the train would be better cause you got to stand the whole way to Venice. 15-20min ride if no traffic! So I suggest taking the train, especially with kids or elderly. Cause for sure, there is be no seats in the bus and it is packed like in a tuna can. So save ur energy and take the train. The hotel breakfast was ok but the food was limited.Eggs, bacon, baby sausages, toasts, fruit with flies, etc. a lot of people for breakfast so you might have to wait in line for a while. So go before 9:30am to avoid the line. The staffs at the lobby was horrible, no smile, dead face, they just rushed through everything without even looking at you. When you ask them a question, they give you this strange unwelcome look. Like at a military base asking for direction. (Brain dead & heartless staffs) The resturant at the was ok, reasonable price and food size portion was great. You can get discount if u eat lunch there but not for dinner. I think they should give discount for hotel guests for dinner too so it was a little disappointed! The resturant staff were very SLOW and forgetful. I had to ask 2-3 times to get sth done. I needed up getting everything myself, ketchup, pepper & plate cause I couldn't wait any longer. There wasn't enough to staffs to work at the Resturant and the place is packed with people since is next to the train station. I think this hotel is over rated. I would give a 4.5/10 for this place!

Show more
Noveda , United Kingdom
Hotel Ai Cavalieri di Venezia
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 71 reviews

Ai Cavalieri is situated mid-way between Rialto bridge, Piazza San Marco, and Fondamente Nove, which is arguably the best location in Venice.

It is easy to reach all the major attractions, but is in a quieter area that does not have the same bustle of tourists as San Marco. It also has a small water canal at the back, which means one can get to/from the airport via water taxi in less than thirty minutes. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a renaissance revival style, with marble bathrooms, embroidered fabric wall covering, and exquisite chandeliers. Everything was perfectly clean, and the room size palatial by Venetian standards. The staff members were both friendly and polite, and the concierges very willing to help. We didn't have dinner at the restaurant, but the buffet breakfast was a spread of tasty cold cuts, cheeses, pastries, fruit, and an Italian take on bangers and bacon. This would definitely be my hotel of choice should I return to Venice.

Show more
Ross , South Africa
Savoia & Jolanda Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 124 reviews

We stayed in the attic apartment which we thought was really cool amongst all the old beams of the roof.

We were told the building was once a convent so although at first impressions were rabbit warren like it is to be expected for a building with rich history. The location is excellent. Just around the corner both directions for great food. Close to Piazza San Marco. Very close to the Grand canal where we were dropped off by water taxi and also could catch the bus ferry to the airport. For breakfast don't eat inside, rather eat at their restaurant on the Grand canal which was a nice way to start the mornings.

Show more
Julian , New Zealand
Best Western Hotel Bologna
8.7 Excellent
Based on 514 reviews

I have mixed feelings regarding Hotel Bologna. Let's start with the pros: The hotel is located literally across the street from the Venezia Mestre train station.

So if you're arriving by train, it is extremely easy and almost impossible to get lost. The close proximity of the train allows you to enter "historic" Venice within less than 10 minutes, this station is called Venezia St. Lucia. We got the look double, which is very spacious and comfy. Our room had enough space for a couch and a desk top table! The bathroom was very clean and modern. Our shower was enormous, it had a large overhead shower. There are no doors to the shower, it's a kind of walk in design. Our towels were hanging on top of a heated towel rack! I pay very close attention to details, so I really enjoyed and appreciated the bathroom. Our booking included breakfast. I have never seen such a full breakfast buffet option while I vacationed throughout Europe. Cons:Wifi is extremely slow, I mean I couldn't even get on Yelp. The power to our room shut off because I plugged in the water heater for tea. A maintenance guy came up and asked me to plug in the water boiler in an outlet next to the door... On the floor. He left and I tried to plug it into the outlet he suggested, and our lights went off again. i just gave up on the tea.The lady that checked in for us was nice, she gave us a map and told us how to reach Venice, but that was about it, she didn't recommend any restaurants or areas to see or visit nearby. The man that checked out for us was even more unpleasant. He was rude, didn't smile much and didn't even ask how our stay was. I even gave him two unused train tickets to St. Lucia, for the next couple that visits, and he didn't even thank me or show any gratitude, even though the tickets were only valued at about 3 euros. I found a bug crawling around the bread one morning for breakfast.

Show more
Elisa , United States
Carnival Palace Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 200 reviews

This hotel is at the far end of Carnereggio, and for those looking to get away from the crowds, this is ideal.

It is right along the canal, and there are good restaurants along this section of the canal. It is thus a quiet and more charming area. Boats stop along the canal, so you can take a boat to most of the tourist stops, or walk about 1/2 hour to the main piazza, exploring as you go The hotel itself is updated, with clean rooms, new showers with good hot water. Breakfast was a great selection of food to please all. Given its location, it is very quiet for sleeping. As mentioned by another traveler, there are disco-type lights going on, which is interesting and odd at the same time. Staff speak English, but don't expect them to go above and beyond to help. Questions are answered matter-of-factly to exactly what is asked, but I think that comes down to communication - we did no speak Italian all that well. TIP: Take the Alilaguna boat from the airport to the Guglie boat stop. We were misdirected at the airport and wound up taking a bus to the station. This was not too bad, a 15 minute walk to the hotel, but you have to cross over two bridges with lots of steps en route. Alilaguna boats stops very close to the hotel. Recommend bring your own shampoo/conditioner as well, as those supplied were not that good. Flea market very nearby at the San Giobbe Church, worth a look. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Show more
Patricia , United States
AO Hotel Venezia Mestre
8.2 Excellent
Based on 51 reviews

Hotel Continental
7.2 Very good
Based on 289 reviews

loved it. Top quality hotel in a great location Beautiful hotel. Other reviewers have made comments about the hotel being in the need of updating, but this is the charm of the place! Lovely William Morris wallpaper & arts and crafts decor.

We stayed on the dinner bed & breakfast for £99/head offer which was really good value. The dinner menu is usually £45/head so this makes b&b only £108/night when other b&b's of a similar callibre charge atleast £150. The food is very good & for those who feel that the portion size is small I'm not sure how much these people expect to eat in one sitting as meal is almost 4 courses with canapés, artisan style bread & amuse bouche! Breakfast was excellent I have never had such a sizeable portion of smoke salmon & scrambled eggs! The staff were very accommodating and friendly. We were upgraded because we wanted to extend our stay by one night & our original room was already booked. As a result we stayed in Westmorland which has a sitting room, large bathroom with jacuzzi bath and a sitting room with tea and coffee making facilities. Nice touches like homemade biscuits supplied daily & evening turn down service with a water carafe nightly. The little garden outside is a lovely place to sit & enjoy the view. This is not a slick, corporate hotel with all the mod cons and generic white washed rooms & if this is what you want then it's not the place for you. But it's somewhere to relax and feel at home & we thought it was great value. One slight gripe would be that last dinner orders is 845pm which can be tricky if you want to come back later after a full days walking. We will definitely be back!

Show more
andrew , United Kingdom
Hotel Rialto
8 Very good
Based on 336 reviews

Direction : once out from Santa Lucia Train Station on your left in front of you is where the "Ferrovia Landing stage (Water bus stop)" located .

You must buy the tourist ticket for easy access around Venixe, you can choose to buy 24,36,72 hour or even 7 days depend on the length of your stay . Once you gotten your ticket, lookout for vaporetto no.2 heading towards Rialto, it is easily found just go to the right side entrance of the landing stage and It is only 2 stop away !! YES thats how close it is, and to make it even better once you reach Rialto Stop , on your left hand side just 1 building away(10 second walk) you are in Hotel Rialto ! That literally explain how convenient this hotel is locale even when you carry huge luggage it is so Centrale so convenient to find . The room wise is decent, with a touch of Old Venice furniture which is lovely and Please take note the Lift only service to Level 1 , so if you carry heavy luggage do reccomend you to ask for a room at level 1 . Breakfast spread is adequate,cappucino is especially good, for the price you pay and this best location ! You cant ask any more out of it ! Bravo Rialto . I'll come back to you Grazie to the reception whixh is always so warm and friendly throughout my 3 day stay . Hope you find this helpful . Ciao

Show more
TOMMY , Singapore
Splendid Venice Venezia – Starhotels Collezione
8.6 Excellent
Based on 239 reviews

hotel was great, 5star...a bit pricy, but worth it for honeymooners. the hotel breakfast is somewhat good considering you are in italy.

.. if you know what i mean. not great, but decent. hotel was just 5mins walk to san marc's square, you get here by the water bus just right outside the train station for just a few euros(~7euros), don't take the water taxi because it will cost you a bomb! hotel staff are not that friendly... it is as though i owe him a million euros or something... at the square during evening, there are pigeons(hundreds of them) and seagulls as well, you can feed them with bread and they will flock around you, nice experience. san marc's church, you must go in, although it stated no photo's allowed, but... i snapped like a hundred photos before someone told me "no photo".... as soon as the guy not looking at me, i start snapping again...

Show more
YEW , Malaysia
Hotel le Boulevard
8.1 Excellent
Based on 112 reviews

It was not great! We were charge $6 euro per day for tax payable by cash only (not credit card) which was difficult for us because of high commissions paid and exchange rate to get euros for dollars.

We did not know that this tax was cash only before our stay. We had a lousy breakfast buffet made up of overcooked scrambled eggs, fruit cocktail out of a can, fruit juice from concentrate out of a can, overly sweet croissants (none plain) so bad if you are a diabetic or have health concerns, and bland cereal. The man running the kitchen was extremely rude to people, and you feel his contempt of tourists. He would give everyone dirty looks one day, and then the next he would put on a fake non-directed smirky smile, like he just spit in the food, so he got his revenge. On the last day, the hotel clerk tried to charge us for a bowl of cereal at the breakfast, but then changed his mind. On another note, you cannot take hotel towels to the beach, which was a bummer, because that meant having to buy two (at high prices at some tourist shop) which only would add more weight to your luggage. The beds were soft and uncomfortable. The doubles had a big crack between the two beds, and I woke up with pains in my back. The high speed internet was the slowest I have experienced in Europe so far. Overall it was not the best experience. The only good points are the hotel is very close to the bus boat, San Marcos Island, and the beach.

Show more
Sherri , United States
Hotel Universo E Nord
7.2 Very good
Based on 313 reviews

I booked a room for 4 and stayed there with my 3 grown-up children. The room was big and comfortable even with all our 4 pieces of luggage.

Breakfast was simple but good enough for us. Location is fantastic and so close to Roma Termini station, you can't miss it. Exit the train station, facing the canal and walk left. Showers worked well with hot water and room was cleaned everyday with towels changed. The only snag is that there is no wifi in the room and you can't use it at breakfast, and understandably so. Otherwise, the breakfast venue will be choked up with guests using wifi non-stop. We just managed with that. The many good things just outweigh the lack of wifi in the room and at breakfast.

Show more
Ho , Singapore
Bauer Palazzo
8.7 Excellent
Based on 77 reviews

This was my 4th stay at the Bauer since 2011. The location is excellent with easy access for sightseeing and water taxi transfers.

However, this stay was disappointing, mostly due to room allocation (room 263). The facilities in the room were perfect (it was a twin, I was holidaying with my sister) but the light levels were absolutely dismal due to the window opening on to a small square services courtyard which rose the full height of the building, approx 5/6 floors (we were on the 2nd, was the floor above reception - so really the 1st floor). We felt like we were in a well. The light levels were so low that It was hard to be accurate about what time of day it was, and our week in Venice was during the soaring temperatures across Europe, averaging in excess of 30 degrees, but light levels still very low, so we kept the curtains closed as it was less depressing. We tried to move room, but they couldn't accommodate us. This stay was not a 5* experience - beware !

Show more
Kathleen , United Kingdom
Hotel Montecarlo
8.2 Excellent
Based on 131 reviews

We had requested a king-size bed for one of the rooms as there were three of us (two adults and a teenager) and thought that we could squeeze, given that European hotel rooms are on the small side, and just top up the extra person's charge.

When the duty manager realised that we'd be three to a room, he arranged for us to occupy a suite with two rooms instead, which made our stay much more comfortable. This was pretty reasonable given that accommodation on Venice itself is notoriously expensive, and it was Carnevale season. Buffet breakfast had a decent spread, enough to fuel up for exploring the city in the morning cool. Have to emphasise that the duty managers were always v friendly and accommodating; our requests were always fulfilled speedily (we requested for a kettle and some cups since there was no in-room tea service, and they were sent up almost immediately). Best of all is that it's very accessible to San Marco so you can get started early on the Palazzo/museum tours, passing the Torre d'Orologio on the way out (might miss the entrance if not looking for it). Getting to the other isles or the further parts of the main island isn't too much of a problem with an imob card, since key vaporetto stops at San Marco and Rialto are easily accessible, especially if you're not dragging luggage with you. One thing to note tho: 1) No A/C, which could make or break your summer stay here (at least it's not directly on the water and won't smell too bad).

Show more
Charissa , Singapore
Ca Rialto House
8.6 Excellent
Based on 51 reviews

The location was perfect as it was at the stop at the Rialto Bridge via public transportation. Just ensure you are heading in the right direction or you may be in for a long journey.

The Rooms were particularly spacious and decorated in period style. Lots of stairs so not recommended for people with mobility issues. The included breakfast had a good variety with sweet fresh fruit, hot items such as eggs, ham, pancakes etc.. This was an annex to the Rialto Hotel where the check in takes place. Would not recommend eating at the Rialto Restaurant at dinner. A so so pizza was slow in coming and had a menu price of 12Euros. The fine print advised of a 20% service charge plus VAT which brought the final bill to over 18 Euros. Because we were not hungry my wife and I shared the pizza to the chagrin of the waiter whose demeanor let us know that he was not pleased that we were only ordering the one item. This was in spite of the fact that there were very few tables being occupied. Food and accommodations in Lido across the lagoon are one half of what they are in Venice. Bear that in mind for your travels when staying for any length of time more than overnight.

Show more
Steven , Canada
The Westin Europa and Regina Venice
8.6 Excellent
Based on 37 reviews

When i got off our gondola boat, the service was good as someone took care of my luggage straight away and the Lobby was amazing but that was it everything went downhill afterwards.

The receptionist was not friendly at all in fact, she was very stiff, rushy and not helpful. The room was very standard old fashioned, average size, basically nothing to be proud of or remembered of.

Show more
Han , Indonesia
Hotel Bisanzio
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 56 reviews

We travelled as a group and had one triple room and 1 double room among us. Both rooms were very large and palatial.

The triple room had a bunk bed on the first floor and a double bed up the stairs. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and offered us directions and recommendations. They also offered to arrange for a private tour from the water way at the back of the hotel to Murano to experience Murano glass making. The breakfast was simple but decent, tasty and filling with a spread of crossoints, cereal, yogurt, cold cuts, sausages and eggs. The rooms are pricey, as are hotels all across Venice. If you're looking for something beyond just a very basic b&b and comfort and upper middle range luxury is important to you, this hotel is a good choice. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again!

A week in Venice, in a Beautiful Spacious Apartment from the Palazzo Paruta Hotel Group, was simply lovely.

Like all of Venice, a bit of a pain with Luggage coming off the water taxi, so unless you have a hotel that is a direct drop off this is standard for all of Venice. When you arrive, the hotel does help with all your luggage and give you a tour of your apartment room. You are not part of the hotel, though you can eat there for a price and they do provide you with all your services. Everyday clean towels, and room housekeeping. We stayed in the Prestige Square View Suite 603 which is a lovely 1 bedroom with amazing views of Campo Sant’Angelo Square during carnival so bonus street performance's entertained us right in our room. Go to Hotels website, click Le Residenze for totally accurate pictures of the apartments. The Location is perfect, very close to everything, especially great restaurants and shopping away from the tourist crowds although still buzzing with people and energy. St. Marco Square literally 5 min. away and just a small travel tip be sure to bring your phone for walking GPS a must for all of Venice and still expect to get lost its all part of the charm of your visit. Fear not upon entry into apartment building there is an odd smell, but not at all in the room. The apartment is immaculate, clean and spacious. The Bed is comfortable, Kitchen and Living Room Modern, and the Bathroom and shower was surprisingly great, with the exception of the blow-dryer, well for an American anyway. A bit outdated, attached to the wall, with no real air pressure. Check if they update if not, girls definitely bring your own and remember proper outlet plugs. Great Experience, and Charming Stay for Mid-Range Price but Luxury Living.

More about Venice

Virtually unchanged for the last 600 years, Venice is one of the most charming destinations in the world. Built on a network of 118 islands in the Venetian Lagoon, Venice was once a prosperous city that had total control over Mediterranean sea trade, armed with a formidable navy. Today, this UNESCO Heritage-listed port city derives most of its income from tourism, with a reported fifty thousand tourists visiting every day.

Venice is famous for its gondolas, canals, and historic architecture. While gondolas still ply the city's waterways, water buses – vaporetti – are now the preferred form of transport for getting from point to point. For exploring the inner part of Venice – the Rialtine Islands – the best method is to walk. Wandering aimlessly through Venice's winding alleyways is an invaluable travel experience and a few hours lost in the back streets will provide as authentic a snapshot of Venice as any guided tour.

Venice's architecture spans several centuries, from 12th-century Byzantine to 17th-century Baroque. The most famous structure in the city is the immense St. Mark's Basilica, situated on the grandiose St. Mark's Square. The Gothic Doge's Palace nearby is also a hotspot for tourists, connected to the prison next door by the famous Bridge of Sighs.

Outside the Rialtine Islands is the Lido – Venice's beach getaway. A short vaporetto ride from St. Mark's Square, Lido is a narrow sandbar, one side of which serves as a private beachfront for hotels, with public beaches at either end of the island. Lido is the location of the Venice Film Festival and where many tourists base themselves to get away from the crowds of the inner islands when their sightseeing is done.

Show more atira , Malaysia Hotel Gardena Venice 7.8 Very good Based on 207 reviews We arrived in Venice via bus (from airport) and left via train so the hotel was ideally situated as there were only two bridges to cross (60kgs luggage). The hotel fronts onto a quiet canal and was only 30 metres from the Grand Canal, perfect. A number of good inexpensive restaurants were a stone's throw away as were a number of good gift shops, with reasonable prices. The room was very nice, clean, and decorated in an old style but lacked power sockets to allow use of a laptop, camera and phone re-chargers. The bathroom was OK. Generally we found the hotel to be efficient rather than friendly, but as we were there only two nights it didn't impact on our enjoyment. Not a bad hotel for the price. Show more Richard , Australia Venice Times Hotel 9.2 Exceptional Based on 68 reviews Staff are very nice. We're glad we booked this place. If you have a LOT of luggage and you plan to book diff hotel in the grand canal area and plan to take the public transpo - this is a BIG hassle because we've seen a lot of tourists did this and it's really tight in the boat. Unless you're going to take the Taxi Boat which are ridiculously expensive. That's the reason why we loved this place because it's close to the train station and going to the grand canal is easy(you can buy unlimited trip for 2 days or 5 days - depending on your stay). We didn't have to drag our 4 bug luggages to the boat and across the grand canal where there are a LOT of people. Breakfast has a great spread. To top it all off, the receptionists are very welcoming and will give you tips on how to navigate across the area. Will definitely be back if we had a chance. We were put in an annex across the alley from the main building. This was accessed by what felt like the service entrance to a much nicer hotel which, unfortunately, we never got to see. The breakfast was over-priced (you can do much better 20 meters up the canal) and the free wifi was only accessible from a 3 square meter area in the lobby at speeds that sent most guests away in frustration. The staff seemed largely indifferent to their guests. Show more Jonathan , United States Hotel Plaza 8.2 Excellent Based on 656 reviews The lobby was the same as the website but not the room. The room need upgrading, sort of old everything in the room. The room should carry the same theme & feel as the lobby but it wasn't. Two different world the room and the lobby! You can be fooled by all the fancy pix. The shower gel and soap was enough for 1 person only. So bring ur own soap or be ready to ask for more! The location was far from Venice but it was easy to reach to Venice by train or the bus. You have to buy the bus ticket from a coffee shop next to the hotel €1.50 per ticket. Taking the train would be better cause you got to stand the whole way to Venice. 15-20min ride if no traffic! So I suggest taking the train, especially with kids or elderly. Cause for sure, there is be no seats in the bus and it is packed like in a tuna can. So save ur energy and take the train. The hotel breakfast was ok but the food was limited.Eggs, bacon, baby sausages, toasts, fruit with flies, etc. a lot of people for breakfast so you might have to wait in line for a while. So go before 9:30am to avoid the line. The staffs at the lobby was horrible, no smile, dead face, they just rushed through everything without even looking at you. When you ask them a question, they give you this strange unwelcome look. Like at a military base asking for direction. (Brain dead & heartless staffs) The resturant at the was ok, reasonable price and food size portion was great. You can get discount if u eat lunch there but not for dinner. I think they should give discount for hotel guests for dinner too so it was a little disappointed! The resturant staff were very SLOW and forgetful. I had to ask 2-3 times to get sth done. I needed up getting everything myself, ketchup, pepper & plate cause I couldn't wait any longer. There wasn't enough to staffs to work at the Resturant and the place is packed with people since is next to the train station. I think this hotel is over rated. I would give a 4.5/10 for this place! Show more Noveda , United Kingdom Hotel Ai Cavalieri di Venezia 9.4 Exceptional Based on 71 reviews Ai Cavalieri is situated mid-way between Rialto bridge, Piazza San Marco, and Fondamente Nove, which is arguably the best location in Venice. It is easy to reach all the major attractions, but is in a quieter area that does not have the same bustle of tourists as San Marco. It also has a small water canal at the back, which means one can get to/from the airport via water taxi in less than thirty minutes. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a renaissance revival style, with marble bathrooms, embroidered fabric wall covering, and exquisite chandeliers. Everything was perfectly clean, and the room size palatial by Venetian standards. The staff members were both friendly and polite, and the concierges very willing to help. We didn't have dinner at the restaurant, but the buffet breakfast was a spread of tasty cold cuts, cheeses, pastries, fruit, and an Italian take on bangers and bacon. This would definitely be my hotel of choice should I return to Venice. Show more Ross , South Africa Savoia & Jolanda Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 124 reviews We stayed in the attic apartment which we thought was really cool amongst all the old beams of the roof. We were told the building was once a convent so although at first impressions were rabbit warren like it is to be expected for a building with rich history. The location is excellent. Just around the corner both directions for great food. Close to Piazza San Marco. Very close to the Grand canal where we were dropped off by water taxi and also could catch the bus ferry to the airport. For breakfast don't eat inside, rather eat at their restaurant on the Grand canal which was a nice way to start the mornings. Show more Julian , New Zealand Best Western Hotel Bologna 8.7 Excellent Based on 514 reviews I have mixed feelings regarding Hotel Bologna. Let's start with the pros: The hotel is located literally across the street from the Venezia Mestre train station. So if you're arriving by train, it is extremely easy and almost impossible to get lost. The close proximity of the train allows you to enter "historic" Venice within less than 10 minutes, this station is called Venezia St. Lucia. We got the look double, which is very spacious and comfy. Our room had enough space for a couch and a desk top table! The bathroom was very clean and modern. Our shower was enormous, it had a large overhead shower. There are no doors to the shower, it's a kind of walk in design. Our towels were hanging on top of a heated towel rack! I pay very close attention to details, so I really enjoyed and appreciated the bathroom. Our booking included breakfast. I have never seen such a full breakfast buffet option while I vacationed throughout Europe. Cons:Wifi is extremely slow, I mean I couldn't even get on Yelp. The power to our room shut off because I plugged in the water heater for tea. A maintenance guy came up and asked me to plug in the water boiler in an outlet next to the door... On the floor. He left and I tried to plug it into the outlet he suggested, and our lights went off again. i just gave up on the tea.The lady that checked in for us was nice, she gave us a map and told us how to reach Venice, but that was about it, she didn't recommend any restaurants or areas to see or visit nearby. The man that checked out for us was even more unpleasant. He was rude, didn't smile much and didn't even ask how our stay was. I even gave him two unused train tickets to St. Lucia, for the next couple that visits, and he didn't even thank me or show any gratitude, even though the tickets were only valued at about 3 euros. I found a bug crawling around the bread one morning for breakfast. Show more Elisa , United States Carnival Palace Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 200 reviews This hotel is at the far end of Carnereggio, and for those looking to get away from the crowds, this is ideal. It is right along the canal, and there are good restaurants along this section of the canal. It is thus a quiet and more charming area. Boats stop along the canal, so you can take a boat to most of the tourist stops, or walk about 1/2 hour to the main piazza, exploring as you go The hotel itself is updated, with clean rooms, new showers with good hot water. Breakfast was a great selection of food to please all. Given its location, it is very quiet for sleeping. As mentioned by another traveler, there are disco-type lights going on, which is interesting and odd at the same time. Staff speak English, but don't expect them to go above and beyond to help. Questions are answered matter-of-factly to exactly what is asked, but I think that comes down to communication - we did no speak Italian all that well. TIP: Take the Alilaguna boat from the airport to the Guglie boat stop. We were misdirected at the airport and wound up taking a bus to the station. This was not too bad, a 15 minute walk to the hotel, but you have to cross over two bridges with lots of steps en route. Alilaguna boats stops very close to the hotel. Recommend bring your own shampoo/conditioner as well, as those supplied were not that good. Flea market very nearby at the San Giobbe Church, worth a look. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. Show more Patricia , United States AO Hotel Venezia Mestre 8.2 Excellent Based on 51 reviews Hotel Continental 7.2 Very good Based on 289 reviews loved it. Top quality hotel in a great location Beautiful hotel. Other reviewers have made comments about the hotel being in the need of updating, but this is the charm of the place! Lovely William Morris wallpaper & arts and crafts decor. We stayed on the dinner bed & breakfast for £99/head offer which was really good value. The dinner menu is usually £45/head so this makes b&b only £108/night when other b&b's of a similar callibre charge atleast £150. The food is very good & for those who feel that the portion size is small I'm not sure how much these people expect to eat in one sitting as meal is almost 4 courses with canapés, artisan style bread & amuse bouche! Breakfast was excellent I have never had such a sizeable portion of smoke salmon & scrambled eggs! The staff were very accommodating and friendly. We were upgraded because we wanted to extend our stay by one night & our original room was already booked. As a result we stayed in Westmorland which has a sitting room, large bathroom with jacuzzi bath and a sitting room with tea and coffee making facilities. Nice touches like homemade biscuits supplied daily & evening turn down service with a water carafe nightly. The little garden outside is a lovely place to sit & enjoy the view. The breakfast is also horrible, so simple: biscuits, yogurt and a horrible cake only.. what hotel will offer customers biscuits nowadays.... and only 3 cheap tasteless things for breakfast? How ridiculous… Simply, if you don't want to screw up your holiday and get rip off by a so called hotel, which some hostel could do a better job, then don't consider this hotel. You could introduce this hotel to your enemy though, or you can try this whole experience out yourself, good luck in this case! Ti amo Venezia Show more Pangari ,New Zealand Discover the neighborhoods of Venice Castello 614 hotels Cannaregio 600 hotels San Marco 526 hotels San Polo 329 hotels Mestre 313 hotels Dorsoduro 265 hotels Santa Croce 190 hotels Lido 100 hotels Giudecca 83 hotels Marghera 56 hotels Favaro Veneto 31 hotels Murano 27 hotels Tessera 14 hotels San Clemente 1 hotel Isola delle Rose 1 hotel Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Venice 1562 Guest Houses in Venice 432 Hostels in Venice 23 Resorts in Venice 7 More about Venice Virtually unchanged for the last 600 years, Venice is one of the most charming destinations in the world. Built on a network of 118 islands in the Venetian Lagoon, Venice was once a prosperous city that had total control over Mediterranean sea trade, armed with a formidable navy. Today, this UNESCO Heritage-listed port city derives most of its income from tourism, with a reported fifty thousand tourists visiting every day. Venice is famous for its gondolas, canals, and historic architecture. While gondolas still ply the city's waterways, water buses – vaporetti – are now the preferred form of transport for getting from point to point. For exploring the inner part of Venice – the Rialtine Islands – the best method is to walk. Wandering aimlessly through Venice's winding alleyways is an invaluable travel experience and a few hours lost in the back streets will provide as authentic a snapshot of Venice as any guided tour. Venice's architecture spans several centuries, from 12th-century Byzantine to 17th-century Baroque. The most famous structure in the city is the immense St. Mark's Basilica, situated on the grandiose St. Mark's Square. The Gothic Doge's Palace nearby is also a hotspot for tourists, connected to the prison next door by the famous Bridge of Sighs. Outside the Rialtine Islands is the Lido – Venice's beach getaway. A short vaporetto ride from St. Mark's Square , Lido is a narrow sandbar, one side of which serves as a private beachfront for hotels, with public beaches at either end of the island. Lido is the location of the Venice Film Festival and where many tourists base themselves to get away from the crowds of the inner islands when their sightseeing is done.
